Package frc.robot.subsystems

Class ArmPivotSubsystem

java.lang.Object
edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
frc.robot.subsystems.ArmPivotSubsystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
public class ArmPivotSubsystem extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
The ArmPivotSubsystem class is the subsystem that controls the arm pivot motor.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ArmPivotSubsystem()
    Constructs the arm pivot subsystem Initializes variables as well as setting initial motor and PID settings

    • getAngle

      Returns:
      the current angle of the arm from the absolute encoder

    • syncEncoders

      public void syncEncoders()
      Syncs the motor encoder with the absolute encoder

    • setAngle

      public void setAngle(double angleDeg)
      Sets the target of the PID control loop to the given angle, with 0 being parallel to the ground
      Parameters:
      angleDeg - angle to set the target to in degrees

    • isClose

      public boolean isClose(double target)
      Check if the current angle is within 2% of the target
      Parameters:
      target - Target angle to check against
      Returns:
      If we're within 2% of the target angle

    • setRawSpeed

      public void setRawSpeed(double speed)
      Sets a raw value for the motor (Overrides the PID controls)
      Parameters:
      speed - the percent output (0-1) to set the motor to

    • setEncoderPosition

      public void setEncoderPosition(double pos)

    • setVelocity

      public void setVelocity(double velocity)
      Switches motor to using velocity PID
      Parameters:
      velocity - the velocity to pivot at (degrees/s)

    • getMagnetClosed

      public boolean getMagnetClosed()
      Returns:
      true if the magnet sensors are within ~2cm of each other
